warnings.title: Heavy rain
warnings.description: Underfoot conditions change rapidly.

warnings.title: Severe thunderstorm
warnings.description: Possible lightning, hail, and strong winds. Stay indoors.

warnings.title: Tropical cyclone
warnings.description: Powerful winds and heavy rain can cause damage. Follow evacuation orders.

warnings.title: Blizzard
warnings.description: Strong winds and heavy snow can cause whiteout conditions.

warnings.title: Extreme heat
warnings.description: High temperatures can cause heat exhaustion or heat stroke. Stay hydrated and avoid prolonged exposure to the sun.

warnings.title: Flash flood
warnings.description: Sudden and rapid flooding can occur due to heavy rain or dam failures. Seek higher ground and avoid driving through flooded areas.

warnings.title: Tornado
warnings.description: Violent rotating winds can cause significant damage. Seek shelter immediately and stay away from windows.

warnings.title: Drought
warnings.description: Extended periods of dry weather can lead to water shortages and crop failures. Conserve water and follow local restrictions.

warnings.title: Wildfire
warnings.description: Dry and windy conditions can cause fires to spread quickly. Follow evacuation orders and stay away from affected areas.

warnings.title: Hazardous air quality
warnings.description: High levels of air pollution can cause respiratory problems. Avoid outdoor activities and limit exposure to pollution.

warnings.title: Avalanche warning
warnings.description: Heavy snowfall or warming temperatures can cause avalanches. Avoid steep slopes and take safety precautions.

warnings.title: High wind warning
warnings.description: Strong winds can make balance difficult and increase risk of hypothermia. Secure equipment and consider postponing climb.

warnings.title: Freezing rain warning
warnings.description: Ice on equipment and surfaces can be dangerous. Use caution and retreat if necessary.

warnings.title: Lightning warning
warnings.description: Thunderstorms can create danger on peaks. Seek shelter and avoid being tallest object in area.

warnings.title: Ice storm warning
warnings.description: Freezing rain can create treacherous climbing conditions and cause outages. Wait until storm has passed to attempt climb.

warnings.title: Whiteout warning
warnings.description: Blowing snow and low visibility can disorient climbers. Stay together and use landmarks for navigation.

warnings.title: Extreme cold warning
warnings.description: Extreme cold can cause frostbite and hypothermia. Dress in layers and bring warm gear.

warnings.title: High altitude warning
warnings.description: Altitude sickness can occur above 8,000 feet. Acclimate properly and be aware of signs.

warnings.title: Rockfall warning
warnings.description: Falling rocks and debris can be dislodged. Stay alert and wear a helmet.

warnings.title: Blowdown warning
warnings.description: Strong winds can cause trees to fall, creating dangerous conditions. Be aware of surroundings and have a plan.

warnings.title: High UV index warning
warnings.description: High altitudes and clear skies can increase UV radiation exposure. Wear protective clothing and sunscreen.

warnings.title: Hailstorm warning
warnings.description: Hail can create dangerous climbing conditions. Seek shelter and wait for storm to pass.

warnings.title: Glacial melt warning
warnings.description: Rapid glacial melt can create unstable conditions. Be aware of potential flooding and debris flow.

warnings.title: Thawing permafrost warning
warnings.description: Thawing permafrost can create unstable terrain and increase the risk of rockslides and landslides. Take extra care when crossing unstable terrain.

warnings.title: High humidity warning
warnings.description: High humidity can increase risk of dehydration. Stay hydrated and take breaks as needed.

warnings.title: Sandstorm warning
warnings.description: Strong winds can create sandstorms in desert areas. Seek shelter and cover your face and eyes.

warnings.title: High water warning
warnings.description: Heavy rainfall or snowmelt can create high water conditions on rivers and streams. Plan alternate routes or wait for water levels to recede.

warnings.title: Volcanic eruption warning
warnings.description: Volcanic activity can create hazardous conditions. Stay up to date on local alerts and follow evacuation orders if necessary.

warnings.title: Frost heave warning
warnings.description: Freezing and thawing cycles can create unstable conditions. Be cautious when crossing unstable terrain.

warnings.title: Solar storm warning
warnings.description: Be prepared for electronic equipment disruption and dangerous conditions for climbers during solar storms. Use backup equipment and communication methods.

warnings.title: High winds warning
warnings.description: Secure loose gear and equipment in high winds to avoid falling or being blown off course. Seek shelter if necessary.

warnings.title: Gust front warning
warnings.description: Take precautions to secure your campsite from sudden and powerful wind gusts caused by gust fronts. Be aware of incoming weather systems.

warnings.title: Downslope windstorm warning
warnings.description: Seek shelter in sturdy structures during downslope windstorms, which can cause severe wind gusts and damage to buildings and trees.

warnings.title: Katabatic wind warning
warnings.description: Prepare for dangerous conditions for climbers caused by strong and persistent downslope winds. Use appropriate clothing and equipment.

warnings.title: Microburst warning
warnings.description: Be aware of incoming weather systems and seek shelter if necessary from powerful downward bursts of wind, known as microbursts.

warnings.title: Blizzard warning
warnings.description: Stay inside or seek shelter during blizzards, which are characterized by strong winds and blowing snow that can reduce visibility to near zero and be deadly for climbers.

warnings.title: Fog warning
warnings.description: Be cautious when navigating on the mountain during fog, which can reduce visibility. Wait for the fog to lift before continuing your climb.

warnings.title: Sandstorm warning
warnings.description: Cover your face and eyes and seek shelter during sandstorms, which can create respiratory problems and reduce visibility.

warnings.title: Smoke warning
warnings.description: Stay informed of air quality alerts during wildfires, which can create thick smoke that reduces visibility and creates respiratory problems. Consider rescheduling your climb if air quality is poor.

warnings.title: Whiteout warning
warnings.description: Stay put or seek shelter during whiteouts, which occur when visibility is completely obscured by snow or ice and can be extremely disorienting and dangerous for climbers.
